entry.title: Release Navigator for SAP Customer Experience - Q1 2025 Update
entry.content:
Welcome to 2025! As we embark on this new year filled with innovations, our team is thrilled to share the first update of the year for the Release Navigator for SAP Customer Experience. The content curated in this tool is intended to help you stay informed about the latest enhancements in your products from the Customer Experience portfolio. Quarterly updates will be provided to explore new features.

In this blog post, you can read about the update plans for the 2025 year and also which release content changes have been made in Q1 for product management teams.

Like 2024, we will continue to deliver content updates for the Release Navigator for SAP Customer Experience on a quarterly basis before product releases in February, May, August, and November. This regular schedule ensures that you will consistently receive the latest updates and content, which are important for your smooth run projects.

Each quarterly update is maintained for products that follow the harmonized release schedule: SAP Sales Cloud, SAP Marketing Cloud, SAP Service Cloud, and SAP Emarsys. You can find the specific product release dates featured on the Product-Specific page within the release navigator. Moreover, the only UX update for 2025 is planned for August. This update is focused on making your interaction with our platform even more intuitive and seamless, thereby streamlining your workflow and boosting overall efficiency.

Disclaimer: These dates are informational purposes only and may change. The Readiness@Scale team has the final decision over any UX modifications.

For SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud, there will be a new update format. Instead of traditional release webcasts, a blog post will be published in advance, with detailed written documentation on current enhancements and improvements. This will allow you to access information at your own pace, ensuring flexibility and convenience. The release content for SAP Marketing Cloud will slightly change moving forward. The team will continue to host release webcasts, offering opportunities to engage with experts and learn about new features. However, they will not create a blog post for the upcoming releases. SAP Emarsys offers a release webcast series throughout the entire 2025 year, and you can find the link on the product page. Additionally, you will always find the URL for the current release webcast there for quicker access.

In addition to the specific content changes for 2502 in the release navigator, for products that follow a specific release schedule, resources are also available for products operating on a continuous delivery model. These include

  1. SAP Sales Version 2
  2. Service Cloud Version 2
  3. SAP Commerce Cloud.

Recap information for these products is provided after each quarter. More specific information is always available on the respective product pages.

As we continuously enhance the release navigator for you, we plan to add new content to the SAP Commerce Cloud product page in the near future. Stay tuned for updates.

With the help of badges introduced last year, you can easily identify new content, content that is about to be retired, or content of high importance on the release navigator.

If you have any feedback or specific requests regarding the release navigator, we would be more than happy to hear from you. We appreciate all feedback and value your input.

entry.title: Stay Certified with SAP Learning
entry.content:
How long is my certification valid?

Because SAP products evolve rapidly, as of April 2024, everyone with an SAP Certification needs to keep their skills and certification valid by completing mandatory yearly assessments.

You need an active SAP Learning Hub subscription to take the short assessment to stay certified. You can access preparation material and take the assessment at any time.

SAP Certifications are valid for one year. If your certification was issued before April 2024, it will expire on March 31, 2025.

Follow these steps to stay certified

  1. Get an SAP Universal ID - Make sure you have a valid SAP Universal ID with at least two email accounts assigned to it.
  2. SAP Learning Hub subscription - Ensure you have an SAP Learning Hub subscription to access the assessment to stay certified. If you have no subscription, you’ll need to book and retake the full 2-3 hour SAP Certification exam every year.
  3. Check your certification status - Log in to My Learning to see your certifications and their expiration dates. Make sure you complete the short annual assessment as soon as possible to extend the validity of your certification by 12 months. If the certification has been retired and you want to retain your certified status, you need to re-certify in an alternative certification. Find recommended alternatives using the SAP Certification finder.
  4. Prepare for the assessment - Find preparation courses or live sessions linked under your certification.
  5. Take the assessment - The assessment is a short, non-proctored quiz with unlimited attempts. Once you’ve completed it successfully, the validity of your certification will be extended by 12 months.
  6. Congratulations - After completing the assessment with the status of approved, click on “Verify course completion”, then it will be confirmed that you have completed the process to remain certified. In my case, 1 day after completing the assessment, the certification renewal date was updated for another 12 months in SAP Learning and Credly.

I hope this blog has helped you renew your SAP certification.

If you found this blog useful, please like, follow and share your knowledge.

Feel free to leave your comment or ask any questions related to the topic.

Clóvis Müller

entry.title: SAP Sales Cloud V2 & S/4HANA: Streamlining Opportunity Management & Order Fulfillment
entry.content:
Introduction

SAP offers a robust suite of tools to streamline sales and service operations. From upselling and lead management to automated order processing and post-delivery service management, SAP provides an end-to-end solution that enhances efficiency and customer satisfaction. This blog explores key features and integrations that drive seamless business processes.

A Short Story: Transforming Sales with SAP

John, a sales manager at TechSolutions Inc., faced challenges in managing leads, generating accurate quotations, and ensuring timely order fulfillment. His team often struggled with manual data entry, delayed pricing approvals, and service inefficiencies.

After implementing SAP’s Sales and Service Cloud integrated with S/4HANA, John’s team saw a transformation. AI-driven Opportunity Scores helped them focus on high-potential deals, while Product Recommendations streamlined upselling. Automated Quotation Management with Price Simulation and ATP Check reduced errors and improved customer confidence. Once an order was placed, S/4HANA Solution Orders ensured seamless coordination between products and services. Automated Delivery and Billing accelerated order processing, and post-sales support was effortlessly handled through S/4HANA Service Orders.

With SAP, John’s team increased sales efficiency, reduced turnaround times, and enhanced customer satisfaction. Now, they can focus on growing the business instead of handling repetitive tasks.

Upselling and Lead/Opportunity Creation

1. Opportunity Score, Playbook & Opportunity Summary

SAP Sales and Service Cloud leverages AI-driven Opportunity Scores to help sales teams prioritize deals. The Playbook feature offers guided selling strategies, ensuring best practices are followed. The Opportunity Summary consolidates crucial insights, enabling data-driven decision-making.

 

Quotation and Order Creation

1. Quotation + Price Simulation + ATP Check

SAP facilitates accurate Quotation Management by incorporating Price Simulation and Available-to-Promise (ATP) Check. These features help validate pricing strategies and ensure product availability before finalizing a sale.

 

 

2. S/4HANA Solution Order

S/4HANA Solution Order enables businesses to combine products and services into a single transaction, offering a unified and flexible sales approach. This ensures seamless coordination between different sales components.

3. S/4HANA Sales Order

A Sales Order in S/4HANA ensures accurate order processing, tax calculations, and stock validation in real time. This reduces manual intervention and accelerates order fulfillment.

4. S/4HC - Automated Delivery and Billing

With SAP S/4HANA Cloud (S/4HC), businesses can automate delivery and billing, ensuring timely invoicing and seamless logistics operations. This automation minimizes errors and enhances the customer experience.

 

Key Benefits of SAP's Integrated Sales and Service Solutions

  • ✔ Real-Time Insights – AI-driven analytics and scoring improve decision-making.
  • ✔ Automation & Efficiency – Automated workflows reduce manual errors and accelerate processes.
  • ✔ Seamless Integration – End-to-end integration between sales, delivery, and service ensures continuity.
  • ✔ Enhanced Customer Experience – Proactive engagement and personalized recommendations drive satisfaction.

Conclusion

SAP’s comprehensive ecosystem enhances sales performance, order processing, and service management through automation, AI-driven insights, and seamless integrations. By leveraging these advanced capabilities, businesses can boost revenue, streamline operations, and deliver a superior customer experience.

Embrace SAP’s intelligent sales and service solutions today and stay ahead in the digital transformation journey!

entry.title: SAP Sales & Service Cloud v2 + ESM - Token Based Authentication (Avoid BasicAuth protocol)
entry.content:
Token-based authentication is essential for several reasons, especially in today's technology with SAP BTP Integrations, SAP Build for web and mobile applications . Here are some key benefits:

  1. Security: Tokens are more secure than traditional session-based authentication. They are typically short-lived and can be easily revoked if compromised. This reduces the risk of unauthorized access.

  2. Scalability: Token-based authentication is stateless, meaning the server does not need to store session information. This makes it easier to scale applications horizontally, as each request is self-contained.

  3. Flexibility: Tokens can be used across different domains and services, enabling single sign-on (SSO) and integration with third-party services. This is particularly useful in microservices architectures.

  4. Performance: Since tokens are self-contained and do not require server-side session storage, they can improve the performance of your application by reducing the load on the server.

  5. User Experience: Tokens can be stored on the client side (e.g., in local storage or cookies), allowing users to remain authenticated across multiple sessions and devices without needing to log in repeatedly.

  6. SAP Build Apps, Side by Side Extensions and API Integration: Token-based authentication is well-suited for various business use cases for designing extensions for web, mobile applications and APIs, where maintaining server-side sessions is impractical. Tokens can be easily included in HTTP headers for secure communication

Note : SSC V2 Currently only REST is supported.  No Odata APIs are existed today

SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud Version 2 - API Documentation 

Below template is ready usable for Visual Studio Code with Rest Client Extension enabled. Just copy and create as file as api.http

###

Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: Basic {{user}}:{{password}}

@accessToken = {{login.response.body.value.access_token}}

###

Content-Type: application/json

entry.title: Compensation Complaint via SAP Enterprise Service Management (ESM)
entry.content:
In every organization, maintaining fairness, transparency, and trust is critical—especially when it comes to employee recognition and compensation. A recent employee grievance case within our company underscores the importance of clear communication, accountability, and structured resolution mechanisms. Here’s how a complex bonus compensation dispute was resolved effectively, with both empathy and procedural integrity.

The Background

At the close of the previous year, an employee stepped up during a colleague's extended leave of absence, taking on significant additional responsibilities. The employee’s then-manager, recognizing the extra workload and outstanding performance, acknowledged this effort through an email promising a bonus reward.

Unfortunately, the manager left the company before the bonus could be processed.

The Dispute

During the annual performance review, the new manager—unaware of the prior agreement—stated that the employee’s current pay grade did not entitle them to a bonus. He further asserted that he was not obligated to honor commitments made by his predecessor. The employee, feeling this was unjust, attempted to resolve the matter informally but received no resolution.

Feeling unheard and unsupported, the employee submitted a formal grievance, citing the unfulfilled bonus promise as a case of unfair treatment.

Step by Step:

Self-service Engagement: The employee raised a grievance regarding the unawarded bonus by submitting a case through the Employee Self-Service portal on WorkZone.

Access Notification to Open Case: The HR receives a notification about a newly submitted grievance case from the employee.

Get support through our Knowledge Base, powered by eGain:The HR Agent consults the eGain Knowledge Base, which the system automatically recommends, to access relevant information and support efficient case resolution where HR can KB via email

Resolution Room with Employee, Manager and Advisory Team: The HR schedules a meeting with the employee, Manager and Advisory in the resolution room to discuss the case.

Update Notes with Resolution Summary: The HR Agent updates the notes with a resolution summary to ensure details are recorded for future reference.

eSignature Request via DocuSign

Closing Case: Successful Resolution: Once the employee completes the eSignature, the system automatically updates the case status to 'Completed,' facilitating smoother case management and ensuring proper closure.

 Outcome

Once all agreed actions were completed—documented, signed, and implemented—the grievance case was marked automatically as completed in the system. The employee felt heard and valued, while the manager was aligned with corporate protocols going forward. Most importantly, the process upheld the integrity of prior management commitments, reinforcing the organization's commitment to fairness and accountability.

entry.title: Optimizing Financial Services with AI: A Seamless Invoice Inquiry Resolution Journey
entry.content:
In the dynamic world of finance operations, managing supplier communications efficiently is crucial to maintaining trust and transparency. With the integration of AI-powered tools, finance teams are now better equipped to handle invoice inquiries with speed and precision. Here's how AI transforms a typical overdue invoice inquiry into a seamless, intelligent support experience.

🔑Key Capabilities

Here are the core capabilities enabled by Generative AI in SAP Enterprise Service Management:

Capability Description
Business Information ExtractionExtracts structured data (like Invoice ID, Order Number) from unstructured inputs such as email subject and body.
Document ExtractionParses structured data from PDF/image attachments (e.g., invoices, checks) using AI-trained schemas.
Document ClassificationAutomatically categorizes documents based on predefined classes (e.g., Invoice, PO, Receipt).
Auto-Executable ExtractionAutomatically extracts and populates fields in the business document tab without agent intervention.
Semantic Business Document TypesMaps extracted data to meaningful backend business entities (Invoice, Order, Request).
Integration with SAP S/4HANAEnables real-time lookup, validation, and posting of documents to SAP S/4HANA and other systems.
Prompt-Based AI GuidanceCustom scenario and schema prompts to enhance extraction precision.

✅Prerequisites

Before implementing these capabilities, ensure the following components and configurations are in place:

Technical Prerequisites

Requirement Description
SAP Service Cloud V2 / SAP Enterprise Service ManagementEnsure the latest release is in use.
SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP)For workflow, AI core models, and integration runtime.
SAP Integration Suite (CPI)To connect SAP Service Cloud V2 with SAP S/4HANA or external systems.

Functional Prerequisites

  • Enabled Case Management module.

  • Defined Case Types and Business Document Types.

  • Prepared Sample Documents (emails, invoices) for schema/scenario training.

🧠 Architecture Overview

 

📩Invoice Inquiry Email Initiation

It all begins with a supplier noticing an overdue invoice. Seeking clarification, the supplier sends an email to the finance team, including the invoice number and an attachment of the original invoice document. This initiates a service journey that blends human expertise with AI-driven support.

 

🚨Real-Time Access Notification to Open a Case

As soon as the email is received, the Finance Support Agent gets an automated alert indicating a new case assignment. This real-time notification ensures that no inquiry falls through the cracks and that agents can respond promptly, improving overall service responsiveness.

 

🗂️ Verifying and Categorizing the Case

The Finance Support Agent accesses the case, reviewing essential metadata such as:

  • Subject
  • Case Type
  • Supplier Name
  • Status
  • Priority

Thanks to intelligent workflows, even newly onboarded agents can consistently classify and prioritize cases, laying the groundwork for a standardized and scalable support process.

🧠 AI-Generated Case Summary

To reduce manual effort and ensure nothing is missed, an AI engine generates a concise summary of the case. This summary consolidates all relevant data points—invoice number, supplier, query type, and more—helping the agent quickly understand the context and make faster decisions.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

🔍AI-Driven Invoice Data Extraction

The agent leverages AI-based data extraction tools to identify and analyze the details within the attached invoice. These technologies reduce the need for manual data entry and ensure accuracy when verifying key information such as:

  • Invoice number
  • Amount
  • Due date
  • Payment status

 

✉️AI-Powered Email Drafting

Using an AI email assistant, the Finance Support Agent crafts a clear, professional response. The email outlines the blocked status, explains the missing items, and requests the delivery of the remaining widgets. It also confirms that payment will be processed upon receipt of the full order.

✅Resolution and Case Closure

Once the supplier receives the response and acknowledges the resolution path, the agent updates the case status to "Completed." The entire process—from inquiry to resolution—demonstrates the power of AI-enhanced workflows in accelerating and improving financial support services.

💡Key Takeaways

  • Real-time alerts drive faster case initiation.
  • AI-generated summaries speed up decision-making.
  • Data extraction tools ensure accurate invoice validation.
  • AI email drafting simplifies professional communication.
  • Standardized workflows ensure consistent case handling.

🚀The Future of Finance Support with SAP

This scenario showcases how SAP solutions integrated with AI capabilities can optimize finance support operations. By automating repetitive tasks, offering intelligent insights, and streamlining communications, finance teams can deliver exceptional supplier experiences—all while maintaining operational efficiency.

Settings for AI scenarios

Generative AI Scenarios --> Business Information Extraction

Step 1 – Define Input Sources
Identify if the case input will come from subject, description, or attachments. Choose based on where relevant information (e.g., invoice number) is typically found.

Step 2 – Configure a Business Information Extraction Scenario
If using subject/description, define a scenario and extraction elements (like Invoice ID). This guides the language model to extract info from free text.

 

Step 3 – Configure a Document Extraction Schema
If attachments are used, create a schema with header fields and descriptions. This enables structured extraction from documents like checks or invoices.

 

Step 4 – Create a Business Document Type
Define a document type with relevant columns (e.g., Invoice ID, Status). Columns pull data from extraction or backend API and allow manual entry if needed.

entry.title: 🌟Unlock Insights Instantly: How to Configure KPI Cards in SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2
entry.content:
Keeping track of performance metrics shouldn't require navigating across multiple apps or digging into reports. With SAP’s KPI Cards on the Home Page, administrators can now offer end-users a personalized dashboard that pulls real-time data from various applications—right at their fingertips.

In this blog, we’ll walk through how you, as an administrator, can create and configure KPI cards to help your users stay focused on what truly matters.

🎯Why KPI Cards?

KPI (Key Performance Indicator) Cards give users a quick snapshot of essential metrics like sales Quotes  and opportunities. These cards are highly configurable and serve as visual indicators to drive data-informed decisions.

🔧Prerequisite: Enable the KPI Cards Feature

Before you start, make sure KPI Cards are enabled in your system.

📌How to enable:
Raise a case under the component CEC-CRM-PM-PF with the subject:"Enable Creation of KPI Cards" 

🧭 Step-by-Step: Create Your KPI Cards

Once the feature is enabled, here’s how to set up KPI cards on your SAP Home Page:

  1. 🏠Enter Adaptation Mode

    • Navigate to your Home Page.
    • Open the User Menu and select Start Adaptation.
    • An orange bar will appear at the top, indicating that you're now in adaptation mode.

  2. 🧩 Access the Card Editor

    • Hover over the border of the My Cards section.
    • Click the pencil icon (Edit) to open the Create Cards pop-up.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  • ➕Select a New KPI Card – Click on the “+” (Create Card) button to start creating a new KPI card.
  • 🧭 Access Tools and Applications – Once selected, the "Tools and Applications" section will appear.
  • 📂Choose Application – From the list, select the application that contains the data source for your KPI.

 

  • 📊View Card Types – You will now see options for Standard Cards and KPI Cards.
  • ✅Select KPI Cards – From these, choose “KPI Cards” to start configuring a performance metric card.

 

 

  • ➕Add Available KPI Cards – You’ll now see available options like Leads and Quotes under the KPI Cards section.
  • 🖱️ Click the “+” Button – Select the cards you want to add by clicking the “+” icon next to each, then click Apply to confirm.

 

 

  • ✏️Customize the KPI Card – Hover over the newly added card and click the pencil icon to edit.
  • ⚙️Edit KPI Card Settings – In the Edit KPI Card dialog:
  • 🔽Use the Saved Filters dropdown to apply a predefined filter.
  • 📊Select the relevant metric from the KPI Fields dropdown.
  • 📈Choose your preferred Graph Type (e.g., bar, line, donut, etc.).
  • 💾Save Configuration – Click Apply to save your customized KPI card setup.

  • 🚪Exit Adaptation Mode – Once all configurations are complete, click End Session to exit adaptation mode.
  • 🏠View Your Dashboard – Your personalized KPI card is now live and visible on your SAP Home Page for real-time insights.

🧩 Use Cases

  • 👨‍💼Sales Managers – Easily track pipeline performance and conversion metrics in real-time.
  • 🛠️ Support Leads – Monitor open ticket volumes, resolution times, and service efficiency at a glance.
  • 📊Executives – Instantly view top-level KPIs like revenue, growth, or customer satisfaction on the homepage.

✅Final Thoughts

With just a few clicks, you can transform the SAP Home Page into a personalized dashboard that surfaces critical metrics for your team or organization. Whether you're focused on operational performance, customer service, or sales growth, KPI Cards offer a clean, visual, and customizable way to stay informed.

entry.title: Bringing AI to SAP: Integrating Amazon Connect Q into Service Cloud V2
entry.content:
SAP Service Cloud offers seamless Computer Telephony Integration (CTI) capabilities, enabling agents to connect directly with contact center platforms like Amazon Connect. In this blog, we'll walk through the steps to configure the CTI adapter in SAP Service Cloud and validate the integration end-to-end.

 

Prerequisites: Amazon Connect Details Required from AWS Team

To successfully integrate Amazon Connect with SAP Service Cloud using the CTI adapter, please collect the following details from the AWS (Amazon Connect) team:

1. Amazon Connect CloudFront URL

  1. Example: https://d23xxxxxxx.cloudfront.net
  2. Purpose: Used in SAP CTI configuration as the Provider URL.
  3. This CloudFront distribution must be configured to host the CCP (Contact Control Panel) for Amazon Connect.

2. Agent Credentials (for Testing)

  1. AgentUserNameParam
  2. AgentPasswordParam
  3. These credentials are required to log in to the softphone widget within SAP Service Cloud.

3. Trusted Origin Domain (for SAP)

  1. SAP Service Cloud domain (e.g., myxxxxx.crm.ondemand.com) should be added as a trusted origin in the Amazon Connect instance settings.

4. Contact Flow Setup (Optional but Recommended)

  1. The contact flow configured to route incoming calls to the right agent queue.
  2. Helps simulate real call scenarios during testing.

5. User/Agent Setup Confirmation

  1. Confirm that the test agent is assigned to the correct routing profile and queue in Amazon Connect.
  2. This ensures the call is delivered properly to the agent via the embedded widget.

6. Call Recording and Transcript Configuration (Optional)

Ensure that call recording and transcript features are enabled in Amazon Connect to leverage the Phone Transcript Summary in SAP Service Cloud.

Step 1: Configure the CTI Adapter

  1. Log in to SAP Service Cloud.
  2. Click on the user icon (top-right corner) and select Settings.
  3. Navigate to All Settings → CTI Configuration.
  4. Choose Amazon Connect as the communication provider.
  5. Enter the Amazon Connect CloudFront distribution URL (e.g., https://d23xxxxxxx.cloudfront.net) in the Provider URL field.

Step 2: Adjust Content Security Policies

To ensure the CloudFront domain is trusted by SAP Service Cloud:

  1. Go to Settings → Content Security Policy Settings.
  2. Add the CloudFront domain (e.g., d23xxxxxxx.cloudfront.net) under all relevant sections to whitelist it.

Step 3: Validate the End-to-End Integration

  1. Log in to SAP Service Cloud.
  2. Click the CTI-Widget icon in the top-right corner.
  3. The Amazon Connect softphone should appear on the right panel, prompting you to log in.

entry.title: Integrating Events from SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 into SAP BTP Event Mesh
entry.content:
The Event Mesh capability in SAP Integration Suite helps you manage your business events. You can publish and consume events across applications using Event Mesh

SAP Event Mesh supports event-driven architectures by enabling reliable communication between distributed applications using events and messaging queues. It decouples the sending and receiving applications, allowing for greater scalability, extensibility, and resilience.

In the context of SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2, Event Mesh can be used to subscribe to business object events — such as a service ticket creation or sales quote update — and route them to downstream consumers like SAP BTP services, third-party APIs, or AI-based microservices.

In this blog, we’ll walk through the end-to-end steps to configure and integrate SAP Event Mesh with Sales and Service Cloud V2 using SAP BTP and CAP/CPI as middleware.

 

 

🛠Prerequisites

Before you start, ensure:

  • Access to SAP BTP (Business Technology Platform) with:
    • SAP Event Mesh service entitlement
    • SAP Integration Suite / CAP Runtime
  • Access to SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2 (Autoflow) with proper admin permissions
  • Knowledge of:
    • Basics of Event Mesh
    • Handling OAuth tokens
    • Service Key consumption via REST/CPI/CAP

🧩 Step 1: Create and Configure Event Mesh Instance

  1. Login to BTP Cockpit.
  2. Navigate to your Subaccount > Instances and Subscriptions.
  3. Click Create > Instance and choose:
    • Service: event-mesh
    • Plan: default

 

  1. Provide a name (e.g., event-mesh-salesv2) and click Create.
  2. After creation, go to the instance and create a service key. Note the credentials (clientid, clientsecret, tokenurl, messaging, etc.).

 

🔐Step 2: Create and Configure Messaging Queue & Topic

  1. Go to Event Mesh UI via the subscribed application tile.
  2. Go to Queues:
    • Create a new queue (e.g., salesv2/quotecreated)
  3. Go to Topics:
    • Add topic (e.g., salesv2/order/*)
  4. Bind it to the queue.

🔗Step 3: Enable Outbound Events in Sales and Service Cloud V2

  1. In the SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 admin console:

    • Navigate tor Extensibility Settings  or Autoflow

  2. Create or update an Communication System .

  3. Under the Outbound Events tab or Autoflow:

  • Add a new Event Topic like salesv2/order/created
  • Provide Webhook URL or Messaging Endpoint pointing to Event Mesh
  • Use OAuth2 Client Credentials (from the Event Mesh service key)

  1. Activate the arrangement.

✅This ensures that every new order created in V2 will emit an event to Event Mesh.

Autoflow

External Hooks

⚙️Step 4: Consume Events (Using SAP CPI or CAP)

Option A: SAP CPI (Cloud Integration)

  1. In SAP Integration Suite:

  • Create an iFlow with an AMQP receiver adapter configured with Event Mesh credentials.
  • Subscribe to the topic salesv2/order/created
  • Use a JSON/XML message converter to map incoming payloads.
  • Route to your target system (e.g., S/4HANA, SAP Build App, external API)
  • Here we are not routing just checking payload

Send message to the queue

The above CPI is built with below below details.

Open a new tab in the Postman.

  • Build the postman URL as below https://<uri of the rest protocol based section from Service Keys>/messagingrest/v1/queues/<Queue name>/messages. Queue name is queue name along with the namespace. Replace the / present in the namespace with %2fwhile executing.

  • Open the Headers tab add below two key-value pairs.

    KEY VALUE
    x-qos0 or 1
    authorizationBearer <the retrieved access_token >
     

     
  • Open the Authorization tab and select the TYPE as No Auth.
 

  • Open the Body tab and select the type as raw. And enter some test message in the body.

  • Select the POST option in Postman and click on the Send button. If sending message is successful, you shall get a status as 204 No Content.

 

🔍Step 5: Test the End-to-End Flow

  2. Check:

V2

CPI

Integrating SAP Event Mesh with Sales and Service Cloud V2 unlocks powerful, real-time, event-driven capabilities. Whether you're using CPI, CAP, or external services, this setup allows scalable and decoupled architectures that respond instantly to business events.

Could this have been avoided? Absolutely.

🧰 Prerequisites

entry.title: Convert SAP BTP Certificate Service Keys to PFX Files
entry.content:
SAP BTP (Business Technology Platform) allows you to create service keys of type certificate. These certificates can be exported from BTP and imported into other systems as client certificates to securely call SAP BTP services using certificate-based authentication.

However, the BTP cockpit provides the certificate chain and the private key only in text form. While some systems may accept this format, others require the upload of a certificate file containing all these details in one piece. (In addition, since it carries the certificate's private key, this file should usually be encrypted.)

I recently set up the integration between SAP Sales/Service Cloud Version 2 and SAP Integration Suite/Cloud Integration, in which I had to convert the textual details from the service key into an encrypted PFX file.

While such tasks are often carried out with command-line tools, such as OpenSSL, where you need to remember all the correct commands, I was looking for an easy GUI-based approach. In this blog I want to explain how to create the PFX certificate with the free, multi-platform GUI tool KeyStore Explorer, which is very helpful for this task.

The process consists of three simple tasks:

  1. Create text files for the certificate chain and the key
  2. Import these files into KeyStore Explorer
  3. Save them as PFX file

 

1. Create Text Files

  1. Open the service key details in SAP BTP and switch to Form view.
  2. Certificate Chain:
    Copy the text from the certificate field into an empty text file and insert line breaks so that -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----, -----END CERTIFICATE----- and the actual certificate content (which is Base64 encoded) have separate lines. Save the file, for instance, as cert_chain.pem
    Please note that the content from the certificate field contains the whole certificate chain consisting of three certificates.
    The should look like this:

  3. Private Key:
    Copy the text from the key field into an empty text file and insert line breaks so that -----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----, -----END RSA PRIVATE KEY----- and the actual key content (which is Base64 encoded) have separate lines. Save the file, for instance, as key.pem

That's it for the preparation step.

 

2. Import Text Files

  1. Open KeyStore Explorer and create a new keystore with the type PKCS#12.

  2. Select the Import Key Pair button in the toolbar and choose OpenSSL as import type. 

  3. In the import dialog, uncheck the Encrypted Private Key checkbox and provide the previously created files for the private key and the certificate file.

  4. You will be prompted for an alias for the keystore. You can simply accept the suggested one. 

  5. Another dialog will appear that asks you to enter a New Key Pair Entry Password.
    Enter a strong password.
    My suggestion: Generate a password with a password manager to store it securely, and Copy&Paste it.
    We'll need this password again when saving the PFX file and later when importing it into the target system/tool.

 

With that, we have all the necessary details in the keystore and can view all the details of the imported files:

 

 

3. Save PFX File

  1. With the full certificate chain and the private key imported into the key store, we can now save the keystore as PFX file.
    In this step, we have to enter a password again to protect the file (since it contains the secret private key).
    Use the same password as during the import. This password will also be needed when uploading the PFX file into a system/tool of your preference.
  2. In the last step, enter a filename for the PFX file, for instance client_cert_enc.pfx
     

That's it! Now you can import the PFX file into the system/tool where you need it. For instance into the Communication System of an SAP Sales/Service Cloud Version 2 system:

I hope this blog is helpful!

Whether it’s writing a blog, answering questions, or organizing meetups like the SAP CodeJam Dubai, I find purpose in helping others discover the value of SAP technologies and building a stronger, more collaborative ecosystem in the Middle East region.


How do you learn in SAP Community?
What is your daily/weekly routine in SAP Community?

My learning in the SAP Community is continuous and intentional. I dedicate specific hours during the week to engage deeply:

  • Daily: I check the latest questions and blogs on SAP CX and SAP Commerce Cloud, contributing where I can add value.
  • Weekly: I write or review blog posts, follow trending tags, and connect with other contributors to exchange insights.
  • Monthly: I host or participate in SAP meetups and knowledge-sharing sessions - both online and in-person.

What sets SAP Community apart is the diversity of thought, and I always walk away with new ideas, solutions, or perspectives. It’s my professional think tank.


What is your suggestion to get the most out of SAP Community?

Treat the SAP Community not just as a knowledge base, but as your professional ecosystem.

Start by actively participating - ask questions, write blogs, comment on others’ posts, and join groups or events aligned to your interests. Consistency matters more than intensity. Don’t worry about being perfect - your shared experiences can help someone else avoid a costly mistake or discover a better way.

Also, connect with people, not just content. Some of the best learning I’ve experienced has come from one-on-one conversations with other SAP enthusiasts who were generous with their time and insights.

entry.title: AI‑Powered Self‑Service Portal with SAP Build Apps and SAP Service Cloud V2
entry.content:
Abstract

In this demo, we showcase an intelligent self‑service portal built with SAP Build Apps, seamlessly integrated with SAP Service Cloud V2 and SAP AI Core. End users submit a service request by uploading an image . The image is analyzed in AI Core to detect key objects or issues; the findings are then merged into the case description so agents start with rich context. We also run sentiment analysis on the user’s text, helping auto‑prioritize and categorize the case. The result is an end‑to‑end, low‑code + AI workflow that reduces manual effort, improves accuracy, and accelerates resolution time.

Use Case: Broken Home Appliance Service Request

Scenario:
A customer’s washing machine stops working and makes unusual noise. Instead of calling customer support, they log into the self-service portal built on SAP Build Apps.

What you’ll build

A responsive self‑service portal where customers can:

  • Log in, fill a lightweight form, and upload a photo (e.g., broken product/utility issue).
  • See real‑time AI insights (objects detected; suspected issue) before submitting.
  • Submit a Service Request (Case) to Service Cloud V2, with AI context appended to the description and sentiment tag auto‑set.

Agents in Service Cloud V2 will see a richer ticket with:

  • Customer text + image URL/attachment.
  • AI object/issue summary and confidence scores.
  • Sentiment label (Positive/Neutral/Negative) for quick triage.

Solution Overview

The solution leverages three modern SAP technologies:

  • SAP Build Apps: Low-code environment for building web/mobile self-service portals.
  • SAP BTP Destination: Secure connection layer to backend SAP services.
  • SAP Service Cloud V2: Manages and tracks customer service cases.
  • SAP AI Core: Automates image analysis and sentiment analysis to enhance ticket information

The workflow (as visualized below) demonstrates how these layers interact:

  • End-to-End Ticket Automation: Instantly raise service requests by uploading an image.
  • AI-Powered Image Analysis: Automatic detection of objects or issues in uploaded images via SAP AI Core.
  • Auto-Enriched Ticket Descriptions: AI writes relevant context and details.
  • Sentiment Analysis: Analyzes customer descriptions for emotion and urgency for better case triaging.

Reference architecture

 

Prerequisites

Before starting, ensure you have the following in place:

SAP BTP Account with access to:

  • SAP Build Apps service
  • SAP AI Core service
  • SAP Service Cloud V2 tenant

Service Keys and Destinations:

  • Properly configured SAP BTP Destination for Service Cloud V2 and SAP AI Core

AI Models Deployed:

  • Object Detection model ( in SAP AI Core)
  • Sentiment Analysis model
  • Basic understanding of SAP BTP, Destinations, and Service Cloud concepts

Step‑by‑step build guide

1.Prepare Your AI Services in SAP AI Core

  • Deploy or onboard your image recognition and sentiment analysis models to SAP AI Core.
  • Expose these models through RESTful endpoints.

2. Configure Destinations in SAP BTP Cockpit

Create destinations for:

  • SAP Service Cloud V2 API
  • SAP AI Core inference endpoints
  • Set appropriate authentication methods (OAuth2, Basic, etc.).

3.Build the Self-Service Portal with SAP Build Apps

  • Use SAP Build Apps’ drag-and-drop interface to design a user-friendly portal.
  • Add functionality for:
    • User authentication
    • Image upload
    • Input fields for additional ticket information
  • Configure data resources to connect to SAP Service Cloud V2 and SAP AI Core via the BTP destinations.

Build the portal in SAP Build Apps

Step 1: Create an SAP Build Apps portal tailored to your requirements.

Step 2: Implement logic to process the uploaded image using SAP AI Core. Extract the description from the image and perform sentiment analysis on the extracted text. Based on the description and sentiment, automatically update the subject line and categorize the case accordingly.

Step 3: Invoke the Service Cloud V2 API to create a case along with the attachment.

Video

 

Summary

This approach shows how you can build a pure destination‑driven integration between Build Apps, AI Core, and Service Cloud V2. By leveraging SAP BTP Destinations, you eliminate the need for custom middleware, keep the architecture lightweight, and still enable AI‑powered case creation with images, sentiment, and prioritization.

entry.title: Release Navigator for SAP Customer Experience - What's New in Q3 2025
entry.content:
The Release Navigator for SAP Customer Experience is continuously being refined to better align with customer requirements. On August 14, 2025, a new user experience and content update was implemented for the release navigator. Updates are automatic, yet significant, as they bring new features and content that enhance the usability and functionality of your products from CX portfolio.

In this blog post, we will highlight the key improvements and additions delivered in Q3 2025.

 

Welcome & Release Calendar Cards 

We have refreshed the designs of two key features on the main release navigator page: the Welcome card and the Release Calendar card, each receiving substantial enhancements to improve your overall experience. The Welcome card now features a visually striking themed image, providing an inviting introduction to our platform and establishing an engaging atmosphere. The Release Calendar card has been redesigned for greater clarity, grouping release events by month to facilitate easier navigation through upcoming updates. These upgrades are intended to deliver a clearer, more visually appealing interface that supports an intuitive and user-friendly environment.

 

You will also notice minor UX enhancements, such as differently coloured notifications on the upper bar of all release navigator pages, as well as a slightly more rounded design for information pop-ups located in the release navigator.

Redesigned SAP Commerce Cloud Page

The design of SAP Commerce Cloud has been modified to improve clarity and organisation. The page is now divided into four sections: Updates & News, Documentation, Services & Tools, and Community. In addition to reorganizing existing resources, we have added substantial new content in each section to make the release navigator product page even more convenient for you. These improvements provide comprehensive information to help you stay informed about all updates and developments related to SAP Commerce Cloud.

  •  At the top of the page, you will find already known webcasts, blog posts related to current releases, and other essential information relevant to SAP Commerce Cloud.
  • Below this section is the Documentation area, which features five distinct cards: Commerce Cloud, Storefronts, Services, Accelerators, and Integrations. Each card leads to a dedicated page offering in-depth content specific to that category.
  • The Services & Tools section has been updated to include several new cards: Services Overview, Upgrade Guides, and the newly introduced Framework Update OpenRewrite. With the latest version of SAP Commerce Cloud, the product now supports an updated version of Java, and the Spring Framework has also advanced to its next major release. As both Java and Spring are essential components of SAP Commerce Cloud, we have added the Framework Update OpenRewrite card, which provides resources designed to smooth the upgrade process and minimise overall complexity.
  • The final section, Community, provides links to the Influence Program for submitting product improvement proposals, a Community page for asking questions or accessing blog posts, and a newsletter subscription page to receive your monthly dose of SAP Commerce News delivered directly to your inbox.

 Migrating Customer Data Solutions Content

As you might know the Customer Data Solutions portfolio was transitioned the SAP Business Technology Platform area some time ago. With the upcoming update to the BTP Release Navigator, all Customer Data Solutions content will be migrated accordingly. For your convenience, CDS materials will continue to be available through the Release Navigator for SAP Customer Experience until Q4, after which they are scheduled to be removed from that location.

 

 

The Readiness@Scale is a cross-solution team responsible for release readiness topics in the SAP Enterprise Support portfolio. Access all the release navigators at Release Ready page and find our team blogs with the tag Readiness@Scale.

If you have any feedback or specific requests regarding the release navigator, we would be more than happy to hear from you. We appreciate all feedback and value your input.

Readiness@Scale with SAP Enterprise Support

Malgorzata Konopelska
